question.text: Which of the following is incorrect for the product of transgenic 'Rosie' cow?

options.text: It had a protein content of <math><mn>2.4 </mn><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">g</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">l</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e.</mi></mrow></mrow></math>
It was nutritionally a more balanced product for human babies than normal cow milk.

solution.text: In 1997, first transgenic 'Rosie' produced human protein-enriched milk. The milk contained the human alpha-lactalbumin, <math><mn>2.4</mn></math> grams per liter and was nutritionally a more balanced product for human babies than natural cow- milk.
